justification: “Experiment 1 was a standard flanker task with arrow stimuli … We were interested in observing how models with dynamic mechanisms for cognitive control would compare …” – indicating the flanker task is used to index cognitive-control functioning.

“An N2 peak occurred 340–400 ms after stimuli appeared in the incongruent but not the congruent condition” – the presence and size of the N2 event-related potential is taken as the neural signature of conflict monitoring.

“An ELI value represents the proportion of incorrect responses that are faster than trials chosen at random (Servant, Gajdos, & Davranche, 2018).” – showing ELI is the quantitative index used to gauge response-capture effects.

“As in the SSP, visual attention is conceptualized as a target-centered density function … The standard deviation of the attentional spotlight changes throughout a trial,” indicating the SSP’s spotlight-width parameter serves as the measure of attentional focus.
